alert.note: Alert for Bee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 22 at 7:18PM CST until January 23 at 10:12PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Aransas River Near Skidmore affecting Bee County. .The 2 to 4 inches of rain that fell in the area has caused the Aransas River to begin flooding. There is a chance for showers and thunderstorms overnight with little rain fall, but some thunderstorms could have heavy rain which could prolong the flooding. For the Aransas River...including Skidmore...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Aransas River near Skidmore. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. Some roads are closed. Crops and pastureland are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CST Monday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 04/05/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Aransas River Skidmore 13.0 13.1 Mon 6 pm 5.4 0.7 0.6 0.6 0.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1030 AM CST.
